source: All the ways I tell myself I love you — Henny Flynn

items.text: I take my time to sit and breathe.
I let the water hold me.
I listen to the birds. And then I listen more.
I trust that I am loved.
I make time for myself.
I rest when I am tired.
I am allowed to take up space.
I soften my shoulders and unclench my jaw.
I allow things to be easy.
I notice what feels good.
I speak kindly to myself.
I let go of what is not mine to carry.
I trust my body’s wisdom.
I slow down enough to feel.
I forgive myself.
I choose compassion over judgement.
I let myself be supported.
I don’t rush my healing.
I allow joy to surprise me.
I am learning, and that is enough.
I welcome tenderness.
I give myself permission to pause.
I am worthy of care.
I let today be as it is.
I meet myself with patience.
I breathe into the present moment.
I honour what I need.
I am gentle with myself.
